7blb4a0eVGkR0y-rhV96Vg.text: Just letting folks know how awkward it was for the owner "Joe" to try and explain how he was not going to let me and my kids buy a friend of our family a dinner which he was in much need for from his restaurant, his explanation was he scares my customers because of is attire and begs from the customers!  Just lets you know how "Old Willy lynch" is still holding people from getting into a better predicament or at least a meal from someone who was willing to pay! uSeJWtBNtTrWKIoYFlkW-w.text: I ordered fish and chips with a side of shrimp. The cat fish was cooked amazing! The food was delicious, not greasy at all and I even liked the fries. The shrimp was also perfectly cooked too. Definitely a place to stop by and enjoy the food. Thanks yelpers for letting me know about this place!

ZdJG6aMjlNTQd1lQyLImUg.text: Great catfish! Their spicy catfish is more peppery than spicy, but the fish was moist and the breAding was crispy and not at all oily. The shrimp was fantastic too. I wanted more hotness overall so I spiked my coleslaw with hot sauce and lemon. It was tasty ;) overall would return to try their other fried fish and the okra.

AYTzAU1UO0engg-E3s7Avg.text: I have been in Phoenix for under a year and have already found the best Catfish in town!!! I meant to take a picture but as soon as I saw it I gobbled it up.  Jalapeno Hush puppies are good as well.  Came right before closing so missed out on Mac and cheese.  The Greens are also good as well and the Peach Cobbler. I will definitely be returning.  Great Service Great Food and Great Price!!!!

Z4M9y89VchFcqDpP4KA7Fg.text: This was our first time eating here and let me say we were more than happy with their food.  The seasoning was on point, chicken wings and catfish we ordered were cooked to perfection.  This is definitely our go to spot for now on for down home cooking.

O8_HkVmwWiq9cRwz1zad3Q.text: Catfish was very good. Ribs were very bad (had veins and fat throughout).

46agLWa-KP8556oDGT8xRw.text: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I EVER EXPERIENCED! !  Owner argues with his customers embarrass them if your order isn't right.He had the nerve to argue with my wife infront of my daughter Because she cant eat ketchup it was mistakenly put on her burger. He Refuse for 10 mins not to change the burger or bun because it was our fault the order was wrong.

zsbolGlLhuUuIlS5MPKS2g.text: This is THE spot in Phoenix for fried fish and shrimp. My two buddies and I each enjoyed orders of two catfish pieces that also came with three shrimp, drinks and one side. we got fried okra, sweet potato tots, collard greens and an extra order of jalapeno hush puppies. The cost was very affordable at about $28 total. It was fantastic! The fish pieces were actually fillets that appeared to be very fresh, lightly dusted with breading and lightly fried. We got the spicy with is more of just some added pepper but it's delicious.   Comparing this to somewhere like Pete's Fish and Chips seems laughable as this is everything Pete's should be but isn't. The breading here is not overstated, everything seems fresh, it's delicious and you get a lot for around $8 per person. I'll definitely be back and I highly recommend Papa Joe's to everyone reading this review!

aJqPrkIYVNTKtIqmVuB5_A.text: Catfish is on point! This place is super good. Fried Okra is also awesome. Everything is fried lightly so you dont leave in a food coma. Try it if you haven't yet.   Owner seems to always be there and you can tell that he and the staff genuinely care about their customers, and not in an obnoxious, over-bearing kinda way.

RRVt6y3odMl6Ld3Mw4YEjg.text: Food was great,and it's a clean environment. The smooth jazz and classic funk helps digest the food,I think? All in all a great experience

I was impressed and i would return.

ijqU5pH2mE1cK0togmKbSA.text: Catfish and Okra are the stars of this show.  The fries, potato salad, and the chicken strips were run-of-the-mill.  But the catfish (I tried only the spicy) was OUT OF THIS WORLD DELICIOUS.  Okra breading was not thick at ALL, which allows you to taste not only the fried breading but also the taste of the okra itself, which is a rare combination.  I love this place, and if you enjoy spicy food and fried catfish, hit this spot - you won't be disappointed.

qT8HAxhJLAuqZopkZFzGlA.text: This was my first trip here after having look around for good southern food. I'm a fried catfish fanatic and I came especially to try it out and it was some of the best I've eaten. I got the 3 piece catfish with 4 shrimp meal with fried okra. I opted for the spicy version and it was just the right amount of spice.. Not too hot but just enough to taste.  Lightly battered with cornmeal and amazingly good. The shrimp were good but nothing compared to the fish and okra.  Now for the okra..OMG..lightly battered with great mix of seasoning made this some of the best I've had. Portions are large..I had one piece of fish leftover.   There is also a lot of BBQ dishes and countless other options and sides. The guy who took our order which I'm assuming would have been the owner was super friendly and very enthusiastic about food. Very reasonable prices with a casual atmosphere.   A great little find and I will definitely visit here many times in the future.

dBNfZJHRqFT6-da4TYgTPQ.text: Today is National Catfish Day, so I thought of having a fried catfish meal at Papa Joe's. I definitely was not disappointed. I ordered the one-piece catfish combo; this included a humongous fillet of catfish. Good thing I decided to order only one piece; two would have been too much for me, even though an additional filet would not have cost much more. The combo also included some fried shrimp, a side (I chose potato salad), and a drink (iced tea for me). The catfish was really good - the fillet was tender, hot, and  juicy and was covered with a light, crunchy batter. They gave me 3 fried shrimp instead of the 2 that was supposed to come with the combo - I'm not complaining about that ;) and the potato salad was quite good. Everything - including the drink - for $6.05 plus tax. It's rare to come across a place that serves food this good and tasty for so little money.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One-piece catfish combo. it includes fried shrimp, a side, and a drink.

Tht8nEgphgH2ykjGiArTuw.text: First thing to clarify: the restaurant is not in the hospital. It is located across the street. Took me forever to find them, especially since the Maps app takes you to the hospital parking lot.   That out of the way, I arrived with a mean craving for catfish. I opted for the three piece, which came with four shrimps, a side and a drink. At about $12, that seemed reasonable enough.   I ordered to go, so I didn't get the in house dining experience. It is very casual. There were a few tables seated when I arrived, and a few people in the back were watching the game on the television set hanging nearby. Total family diner style.   It took about 10 minutes for my order to arrive. I found that the shrimps were perfectly seasoned. They were just...just so delicious. The catfish was curious. Of note, Papa Joe's has the seasoning and batter on point! It was so light and fresh! As though they grew the plants for the seasoning out back. But, strange thing, the catfish did not taste like catfish. It looked like catfish and smelled like catfish, but it was so very, very light. That was the only downfall. Other than that, very nice find.

oyucGn40-m4EMcbXbFTM5w.text: My wife happens to be from the South.   So after we de-planed at PHX and picked up our rental, she naturally found this place on Yelp as we driving!  Papa Joe's isn't in the most glamorous part of Phoenix.  In fact, you may feel a little nervous around this neighborhood.  My wife and I didn't have any trouble though.   We parked in the strip mall parking lot where Papa Joe's is.   Walking inside, this a hole-in-the-wall mixed in with some down home love.   Papa Joe's is a very nice, gracious man.   And his son is really great too.   My wife did all the ordering:  6 pieces of catfish, 2 orders of fried okra, an order of peach cobbler and an order of fried green tomatoes.   Now unlike my wife, I'm in LA boy.   When I first heard my wife utter "catfish," I was already thinking about how it was going to taste like it had sand in it.   I also wasn't too thrilled that everything ordered was fried, except for the cobbler.    But I worried for nothing... The food here is amazing.    The fried catfish was so damn good, that I've told so many people about it.   I can't wait until my next business trip into Phoenix and Scottsdale to go back here.    The okra, tomatoes, and cobbler were off the charts too.   If you're from the South, or are looking for some good cooking, you have to come here.

FEnclOWpRVzxkBmn227iFQ.text: Thanks to Yelpers, I found a great place again. I was just driving through Phoenix on a long trip form Texas to California and I needed a place to get dinner after 9 hours of driving. I had a hankering for BBQ. When I saw that they had fish and BBQ, it peaked my interest. After a 6 mile drive from the hotel, I found the location and it looked nice from the outside. The construction on the street almost made me merge to the left which would be the wrong side.  Anyhow, as I walked in and saw the ordering counter on the left, I was greeted (by Joe?) and asked what I wanted. I wanted to try the Spicy cod and I wanted ribs. He recommended the Fish and Shrimp plate and I could get ribs for $2 each. So that's what I did. He asked if I wanted fries and I asked what he would recommend. He said the okra. Okra it is!  As I waited, I noticed the inside was cozy and kept nice and clean. There's a drink bar where you can get anything you want and the food prep happened right across the room. While trying to move into a position to see the TV better, I spilled my tea. Joe was more than gracious and came over to clean it up with out incident. I tried the tea and the lemonade. I like it when a BBQ place lets you get all the drink you want. That's the way it should be!  When my food came, I wasn't disappointed. There were 2 pieces of cod, 3 shrimp and okra. There was also some cocktail sauce and 3 packets of tartar. As for the ribs, they were nice and big, probably 7-8 inches each. They were covered in a delicious sauce. Both had some spicy pickled peppers as well.   The Fish was nice and thick at about 1 inch! It was cooked very well and the batter was light. I ordered the spicy, but it wasn't too spicy for me. That was fixed with some hot sauce. The shrimp were good, about average. The okra was seasoned very well. I didn't need to dip it in anything. The ribs were delicious. Nice and meaty and a good smoky taste. I really liked the sauce as well. It had a great mix of spicy sweet and accented the ribs quite well.   So the entire bill was about $15.00. Recall I ordered a combination and the extra ribs. It's not a bad deal at all considering the amount and quality if the food and the fact that it also included a drink. I can highly recommend this place. Yum.

yuUkhpoLe7tKFWynSNJ4XA.text: I had a wonderful lunch here today.  I was looking for something new and yelp steered me here.  I had the brisket with mac n cheese and jalapeno hushpuppies.  I've driven by here for years and never stopped, I won't make that mistake again.

II5PP613SDOVVKSAZowvYQ.text: Great place, kinda a hole in the wall. Got the fried catfish, came with a couple shrimp, and mac n cheese...all was very good.  They do things right here. You can tell when you walk in the door because they are selling plenty of seafood and they are frying most of their menu but you do not smell fish and you do not smell oil. I thought it was a bit pricey at first but definitely worth the money for what you get. Well done!

zGXN1URMP6nwAzEb8TRxhg.text: I love this place. Ordered 2 cod plus extra tarter sauce. Ended up with one unused sauce - bought more fish!

YPPsDKneQ5Q98xdquD1Ckg.text: Well I finally gave Papa Joe's a try. I have driven by this place many times and have even had people tell me about it but just never made it. I took my mother to the eye Dr. today and thought it would be nice to go out for lunch after. This place popped into my mind because, once again. I had driven by just the night before.          We went in and checked out the menu on the wall. After going through about everything I ordered the catfish and shrimp as well as the 2 piece ribs combo. My mother ordered the catfish as well with the potato salad. Food came out pretty fast and I dug in. The catfish was fantastic!!! I ordered the spicy and it was full of flavor and cooked very well. I then reached over and tried the ribs. This was the only thing that did not floor me. They were very good but a bit to peppery for me. Good size ribs with lots of meat but still maybe a 3 on the 5 star scale.       The sides were wonderful. I had the onion rings and the okra with one order and the mac and cheese with the other. All of which were excellent. My mother loved her catfish and shrimp. Which reminds me, my shrimp was very good and would love a big plate of those guys.         All in all I would strongly recommend Papa Joe's. I will be back for more of that catfish and just about everything else I can try.   One last thing, the pecan pie was excellent. I could not resist. I wanted to try the sweet potato pie but they were out so I had the pecan instead. I was not unhappy with my choice.

ysS-j5xgmGpLOKnsFLRnVA.text: I had the regular catfish, hush puppies, and fried okra.  The wait was a little long, but that's when you know they're making it fresh to order.  Food was very hot and crispy.  I really liked it.  Light and flavorful.  My roommate got the turkey burger and it was not impressive at all.  Pretty small.  I would definitely go with what they're known for and have highest reviews.

MDy3BSQ1y9Ayr-4-7nyj1Q.text: I go to papa Joe's at least two times a week, I usually get the pulled brisket sandwich combo, with. onion rings, and mac and cheese. The sandwich is Delicious the brisket is really tender and flavorful nice BBQ sauce on it to. The onion rings are nice and golden brown the mac n cheese tastes awesome as well.  This is a Family owned restaurant, everyone is friendly and courteous and you get treated like a valued customer. They also sell Catfish which I hear is the bomb allot of folks get it if you like some tasty deep friend catfish try some at papa Joe's.  If your looking for some good BBQ in a warm and friendly environment you should definitely try papa Joe's.

YlBu351oJOO0LH7dE3JOcQ.text: I give this place 5 stars. I give all places 5, then "take away" stars for what's lacking. Excellent service (c'mon, it's just a small place, with the tables and the red checkered plastic tablecloths) and Papa Joe served me - older guy who looks like he's been around a while. Had fried fish 'n' chips and fried okra. Great! Good food, cheap prices - the only problem I had was the location - it's too easy to miss.

YqCaf12Uz5zt2e8AU3UijA.text: I decided to try Papa Joe's for the first time the other day.  I've driven by it regularly and have always wondered what it was like.  It was very good!  I ordered the lunch special (pulled pork bbq) while my friend got the fish.  Both meals were affordable and delicious and the staff was very friendly!

b0tRrgMwut7oA4w6wEQGHg.text: let me preface this by saying that it is rare to find a restaurant in phoenix that has character and personality.  you go in and ask an employee what they like and what you should order to get a good idea of this place..they stare blankly or respond 'i dont know everything is good.'  Being from dallas i was so used to restaurants that have people with a genuine love for what they do and the business they represent.  Which leads me to Papa Joe's.  This place was amazing.  I asked the gentleman at the front counter and told him it was my first time there and what he suggested that I order.   "one piece fish three shrimp, pork rib, hot link. fries.'  so thats what i got.  had a good conversation with the man who was from texas as well football and whatnot.  good texas homecooking.  heh.  i ordered to go  but enjoyed my ten minutes of waiting for the food talking to the staff and even talking to the man's wife whom he introduced me to.  he said i would enjoy the good homecooking being from texas and all.  this food blew my mind.  atmosphere was great.  staff was incredible.  food was to die for.  go.  seriously. price was ridiculously cheap.  paid around 9.00 or so for all of that food and a drink.  cheaper than anywhere else in town.  the ONLY negative is that i couldn't stop myself from eating until i was sickeningly full.  seriously.  it's that good.

qbIsIEkTK_NbioS2dZ6U4g.text: I'm sure just like the other reviews , this place is the bomb! Catfish nuggets are great as well as everything else . Does get busy so either so phone order or you may ya e a little wait but it's definetly worth it ,

iJi1DL8f-DFxS7BRNUDf9Q.text: I wanted to find a good soul food restaurant while here in Phoenix. Being from the east coast, I'm use to a certain type of soul food restaurants. First, I prefer my sandwich on sliced bread and not a bun and I expected two pieces of fish for a sandwich versus one piece received. The mac & cheese i'm sure is prepared either daily (at least I hope) or it was from the day before, very average. I ate one of the onion rings, cause I had enough of the fried food taste from the fish.  Be prepared to wait upwards of 15mins for your ordered main dish, cause again the sides are pre made and sitting in a warming container. I'm still looking for a good soul food spot.

0yEcmEZmVmL3xK5mch7bdQ.text: Had the spicy cat fish and fries. Very flavorful, the batter was nice. Nice setup, owner takes the order, and good look-aid. Definitely recommend, will be going away!

yZm32K6J5GxFLfcZS6eIdw.text: Tried this place out today as my boyfriend had a hankering for some fried catfish. It has a very comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. I ordered the pulled brisket sandwich combo and my boyfriend got the 18 piece catfish nuggets. My brisket was delicious and tender with just the right amount of sauce. I decided to step outside of my norm (I never have liked fish) and try a piece of my boyfriend's catfish and it was amazing! It was so flavorful that I snatched a second piece. Definitely going back.

GHhCT3Vrv3WYRxKUGHN_tA.text: Today was my first time there. I ordered the fried catfish and shrimp and loved it. Can't wait to go back tomorrow to try the fried chicken!!!

n_JL97LnQaSllnDFQQDrHQ.text: Always drove past this place but never stopped by.  My brother and I had a fish and chip craving and used Google Maps to search for a fish and chip place nearby.  After looking at the reviews and photos I just had to give it a try.  I am glad we did.  Best fish and chips I have ever had in Phoenix in a long time.  There's been a few places in the past that were good but sea food places are not very big here.  Too many taco, pizza and sub shops.  I will be coming back to try other menu items. We had the 3-piece regular cod, four-piece shrimp and large fries.  Also, a side of mac and cheese which was good.  It comes with regular size drink.  Bill total was $40.10.  $14.48(fish, shrimp and fries) +1.99(extra fries) +1.99(mac and cheese) =$18.46 x 2=$36.92+$3.18 tax=$40.10.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nEpuhbCz6SoqVG_Lubx4cw.text: If you've never been here before, just go.  Unless you don't like fried food - in which case, yeah probably avoid this joint.  The catfish / catfish nuggets are BOMB - and I don't have much to compare it to not having had much catfish, but the seasoning and flavor are out of this world.  The mac n' cheese was good and so were the greens but I didn't care for the okra (mushy) or the coleslaw (he puts sweet relish in it - and sweet relish ruins anything for me)... hush puppies were worth trying - but you absolutely must try the catfish.  I tried one of his wings - and it's not your average wing - it's practically half the damn bird.  Again, the seasoning was perfect and it was cooked to perfection.  We were greeted and our order was taken by Papa Joe himself.  Whenever I meet a local business owner who knows his product is money and yet remains humble and down to earth I'm instantly a fan.  He had a few recommendations - which reminds me, they have like four different kinds of Kool-Aid on tap and I suggest the cherry limeade.  This place is legit and I will most definitely be back!!

P-Mrnh7aSnKP5Tid7BqmSA.text: My fav, catfish nuggets and fried okra so good! Love this spot. The catfish is my favorite on the menu and they also serve catfish nuggets. The jalapeno hush puppies are also tasty. This is the perfect spot for a quick lunch with a soul twist to it they also have koolaid!!

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cYeP3PYkmnoRVnFwbUtbeA.text: Best BBQ in Phoenix by far. Every time I go I have the hot link sandwich with onion rings and baked beans. Whenever I'm in the area I make sure to stop by from time to time. Also, the chocolate chip cookies are great as well.

21eLsK1b4LFdjqdQbpPuwg.text: I thought the last place I went to was the worst. Nope! If you came here for the barbecue and gave this place anything above a one then it is clear to me that you have never made it out of the hood to get good barbecue. The absolute worst ribs I've ever eaten in my entire life. Zero smoke flavor, zero spices, wayyyy too much salt.  Additionally, it is clear that the ribs were cooked at least 24 hours or more ago.

lgSeE4c91kCOhWHQSHaodw.text: I had beef ribs( They weren't tender and had plenty of fat. Also the barbecue sauce was watery and just not good) greens (They were ok not much flavor and a bit too much vinegar for me) The corn bread fell apart after taking one piece. It was very dry didn't taste like it was mixed well before cooking it. So of course it was nasty. Now the fried okra was good, a little spicy with plenty of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hJx0P_nh2hjufjTS0aheZA.text: Excellent deep fried fish, nice crispy outer shell for a good cooked fluffy and flaky meat for a great meal. The baked beans I can never get enough. My nice dinner run on the weekends.

_GlsFJjdt-A20ACdQQfZuQ.text: This is my sides place.  You know the place you stop by on the way home and get some ready-mades to go with whatever is in the crockpot or with left over meat from the day before.  That said, I love, love, love the peach cobbler!  30 seconds in the microwave at home and yum.  I often order the greens and the fried okra or the hush puppies.  The okra has a spicy breading and the hush puppies have a peppery kick that satisfies.  I have tried other items on the menu and didn't like what I got.  The fish, cod, was not cook thoroughly and the hamburger was meh.  I did try the pulled beef sandwich and found it dry and the sauce was not tasty in the least.  So I stick to what I like.  I don't eat pork or catfish so this review is not for those who do.

vVsGjCYYxuadle6ZPsnDrg.text: Hands down the best catfish in town! The service was so fast didn't waste no time in having my order ready!! The purple cool-aid is a plus!!

VQUMPjYdMNdPVeeLVZ99sg.text: The food at this restaurant was superb. I ordered Catfish, it was sweet, salted to perfection and was just downright good. Rare to find a place so congenial like home. The atmosphere was friendly. I had arrived with an Olympian and she had a great time as well. Thank you for the exciting experience in both food and friendliness!

HW9BK-dgVcEGEkw3zWJQMw.text: This place doesn't seem like much but it has amazing food.  It is authentic Louisiana style food.  Cat fish, pulled pork ribs etc and it's great! They should have a food show here to show case it.  Low key style good comfort food.

_om_7Ol1eeGCEZbbVrQ-yw.text: Get the hush puppies and any of the food its all good , parking can be a problem but worth it

2OkfU2a2gs4QDTGNuvGkIg.text: I found this place on Yelp after looking at its high reviews and went for dinner last week. It's located in a sort of run down strip,shopping center. After walking in I noticed it is a counter service only restaurant that centers on seafood and BBQ but the menu has more seafood items than BBQ. Because of that I decided on fried fish and ordered the whiting which came with one side and I chose fried okra. I then decided to also try their baked beans as another side that I paid extra for.   The food arrived about 15 minutes later. The whiting was excellent! The flavor along with being fried properly allowed me to really enjoy that fish (4.5). The fried okra was good and I rated them at (3.5). The beans were ok and I gave them a 3.   The owner was taking orders at the cashier stand and was very friendly. This is a place you come to that is laid back and casual for a good meal. While there I got the impression it is a popular neighborhood spot which is good. I wish I could have tried some of their Q but the whiting really was excellent!

2LBdNKWLvtJb4pdh1n05Xg.text: I'm visiting from California. And i am one of the hardest catfish critics. Not gone lie. PapaJoe's catfish is on POINT . And you have to taste the cookies. Me and my wife will be coming back soon. They made us feel like home.

XHZR9_fogFC1S7R9Xu-Ntw.text: They put the sole in soul food! Walk in and ask "What should I order?"  It's one of those places where if you follow directions you just can't go wrong. Undeniably damn good food! Had the hot fish with butterfly shrimp and a side of potato salad just like the man recommended and was plain ole floored.

y2iaZJbQhwRvmoN3LDf0HQ.text: Been here a couple of times. The single catfish with mac N cheese: Catfish was delish! Crisped to perfection and tasty. The mac N cheese was decent, the noodles a bit over cooked but extra cheesy like I would make it at home.  The single whiting and sweet potato tots. OMG, who doesn't love sweet potato tots?!? I think they double fry it, but whatever they do, its got a crispy outside soft inside. I think the whiting was too "fishy" for me. First the look, the inner part was a purplish brown that didn't look appetizing and I put to the side. I didn't care for the smell.  The lady was super nice who took my order. The restroom was clean and she had to unlock it for me. The decor was hip and I liked it, they had the news going on the screen which I liked.

0S6ECrjrpOXDl-ZrYtiQQg.text: Amazing food! My buddy from Kansas City and I were starving and he was craving a taste of home. Found this on here and had amazing reviews. There was a place much closer to me but this place looked much more authentic and the food looked real and not dolled up or overstated.   Got there and the atmosphere was amazing. Small joint in a strip mall next to a quaint grocery store and barber shop, right off historic Bethany Home Road. Very nice people behind the counter and seemed like a down home family establishment.   The lady behind the counter was very helpful in my decision to get the spiced cod and my buddy insisted I got the fried Okra (my first time). And I HAD to get the corn bread!  The food came and it looked like it was prepared with love and carefully placed on the plate. Everything was amazing! My buddy got the catfish and he thought it was amazing as well. And the hot sauce is to die for!  Would recommend, 10/10. I will be back

5CnrDKPb4oNSVHc2M3JY9Q.text: One of the very few places that I can go to in a Phoenix and get truly good mac and cheese. Every time I go, the food is done right!

qhJpx-L8xoZea5IwFQltKQ.text: I have had better in many ways. But where do I start.  It took about 20 min to get our order. Not exactly a speedy lunch.  My $2 side of jalepno hushpuppies was very small consisting of 5 of them about the size of tatertots.  My whiting sandwich was just once price of fish where breading on t e bottom was soggy and a lackluster bun for $4.  Tartar sauce is rationed in small little cups.  The Ambiance is also lacking in this former quiznos, the floor still sports a Q, most of the burned out light bulbs have yet to be replaced and the Oder of something permeated my clothing.  Slow service, bad prices and medicore food, I just don't get it.

8v4eGbT8fVq6C8oOht5zgA.text: A little pricey, but it was good. I took a star away because the fish was a little overcooked. It got rid of my fried fish hankering. Free drink refills and HUSHPUPPIES! All in all I recommend trying this place. I will go back again.

lGpvdoDQIVFcAj5_zQuWlw.text: We were looking for a good place to have fish and chips and I found this place on Yelp. I agree with the other reviewers that say this place is very good. It is a simple place in a strip center and I probably wouldn't have just stopped by, had I not read the reviews. We had the spicy catfish and the cod. I had the okra which is one of my favorite things in the world and it was very good. It was not greasy and everything was freshly made. We were greeted with a smile and made to feel very welcome. We definitley will be back.

Af-IMsgpx2ZSoI0h9o_0Hg.text: Went there with a friend for lunch Friday and again AMAZING!! The catfish and shrimp combo is the best. Affordable, tasty, and the staff are so polite and professional. Also try the catfish nuggets so much for a small price my friend loved it.

qSdpoIEfUx4ek_mJ8kiu0w.text: Tried here last weekend! We had catfish, okra, and onion rings, all very good! Not a fancy place but don't care about that, came for the food!!! Large portion size, recommend 1 fish not two, so full! My only concern was we got mild not spicy on the fish and it still was a bit spicy for us! We both suffer from heartburn so try to eat less spice! But never the less everything was tasty! Really far from home but if in area would visit again!

0z_RiRqO9Ykc05yXqeOQ2w.text: Catfish is awesome! Jalapeno hushpuppies also rock. But what makes the food is the perfect blend of horseradish in their cocktail sauce!

_V0tQ9wh77R3KjEOLBEwJQ.text: Good news:  cod and mac & cheese hits the spot. Food was hot and service very quick.    Bad news: okra was thick and tough, potatoes in salad were undercooked.    Tips:  Fix ventilation system so smoke is exhausted to outside.  Play some R&B music.  I will definitely give this place another try because I like the soulful, homey atmosphere.  .

PH-w9fkC3gj4qjgrLfnYEQ.text: Southern fried fish is hard to find outside of the south!  I found it HERE!  Crunchy outside, moist inside!  And it tastes like fish!  Not the fish that's been frozen so long it's tasteless!  Always a delight to stop in! I love the whiting and fried okra!  The buffalo wings...eh, Mac & cheese is just ok. I LUV fried okra, so I get double okra as my side. Drinks are included with meal!  Cool, casual place!

FEk7-Qo4s-0W2JL_M0rWmQ.text: The cod was excellent! It was perfectly prepared. At Papa Joe's the customers feel nurtured and cared for. The great combination of food skills and people skills shows why Papa Joe's has been a success for so long.

R9_p_iqkf4RsizznuEde6A.text: I love fish and this place was recommended and great recommendation.  I had the catfish and shrimp which was cooked to order and was delicious.  The catfish was seasoned well and nice and crispy.  The only draw back is that bread, pickle, and onions is not included but paid extra to have with my fish.  Being from the Midwest is how we do it and will be back.

j6cM7KsVKUMUDa2T8akd_g.text: THE best spicy catfish in town!  When I'm in the area I always stop. I've tried the barbecue and it is great too. But, it's the catfish that keeps me coming back for more. Prices are good too. I never leave hungry!  Oh, and don't forget the okra or onion rings. Mmmmmmm!

oHS-j7_Y8mxZ3IyNOUpJ4g.text: Was in the area and hit yelp and saw this place so I decided to give it a try. Am I glad that I did. The food is delicious. I will definitely be returning to try the shrimp.

ZIB3Ky7Mte4T_-TYY3o6pw.text: My hubby and I just had lunch at papa'Joe's. YUM to the 10th power! Marc had a burger( like always) he loved it. I had two piece cod and 3 shrimp. 278NxrkMVJYmQTCdjEvXpg.text: This place knows how to fry some grub. I have been to Papa Joe's a few times now and I keep going back for the spicy catfish. I love the light breading. pOHBv28XA2RlifwpI8PPfw.text: This place is cheap delicious bbq and fried fish. They also have three flavors of Koolaid. Very friendly. If you get the fish go for the spicy it's perfectly seasoned. D0tPnqxdIFgteA33eSZZIQ.text: I wish I could leave no stars. One is too much. We waited for an hour, and it wasn't even busy. Everyone was complaining about the ridiculous wait. fkdlgV5XCrHzStIgGj9ALQ.text: Was looking for a good fish and chips in phx this is the place to go home style catfish breaded to perfection and the portions definitely delicious my new favorite spot

4CDW_bidU35q-WZHosoEKA.text: A nice little place - clean and bright - with outstanding service. But the star of the show is the fish of course. Lightly breaded, tasty, fresh, and plenty of it. Comes with yummy tartar and seafood sauce, and some packets of lemon juice. The sides, especially the jalapeno hushpuppies, are delicious! Haven't tried the burgers, but I have to imagine they're great, too. So that's atmosphere, service, food. Now... price. Really, really reasonable for a fish house. Had a 3-piece catfish dinner (they all include 3 fried butterflied shrimp) with onion rings, and the catfish nuggets with hushpuppies, 2 fountain drinks - $22. Yeah... $11 each. That's about half of what you might pay elsewhere. Highly recommended.

d1JHpXBZnmpnkuOoZdhMCw.text: This is my 2nd time eating here. Both times have had fried shrimp mac n cheese and koolaid. Quick for lunchtime. Delish!

douhClJRPklx7uKFUESvxw.text: Great catfish and shrimp. I'd you love southern fried fish, this place is a must. Papa knows what hes doing.

7V2ddBUyngORToJ0CM8L9w.text: This was my first time and the fish is the best I've tasted in AZ! Fresh and hot! I liked the ribs and my boyfriend loved the hush puppies. We loved the Mac n cheese too. The soda was strange but the Kool-aid was perfect. The staff were welcoming and friendly. I'll definitely be back.

ohBNZvntLgcE_oAewqoXkw.text: This is a run down hole in the wall but the catfish is unbelievable. They also have whiting, cod and shrimp.  The price was excellent too.  A combo with a drink and a side was  under $10..  The side of Mac and cheese wasn't the best but they made up for it when I had the collard greens.    Don't wear anything fancy here just some jeans and sneakers and a large appetite.    Yes!!! I'll come back.... Definitely!!!

cWyXoGfCwiALwB6d8FC0yg.text: You might have to wait a couple minutes for your food but it comes out hot and fresh and very good.  Today for my side for my cod and shrimp I got okra.  It was hot, good and they are generous with portion.

JswEArVaDh4KdyVKUzclRQ.text: We were referred to this place, and all though the people were friendly behind the counter I just felt unwelcome the whole till we were there.  So I would have to say I just wouldn't  come back.  The flavor of the food was good.  The food is on the pricy side for what you get. I don't mind paying a higher price for good fish and chips, and if the fish is just ok, sides are small, and I walk out hungry, I will continue to look for a great fish and chips place.

8CPgQTxvoGRLF28k_3xkLA.text: I go to this place just for the collard greens been coming back 1+ year. They just added sweet potato tater tots and theyre bomb. The fish is seasoned perfectly everytime they never disappoint

2MwOi1Gvru17l81BazQcRQ.text: What a great hole in the wall.  The fish and chips couldn't have been any better.  The burger was everything a burger should be, real, not fancy, just great food.  Thanks Papa Joe...

kfCrHWDZzofbw2rXYG8-Dw.text: OMG......it's sooooooo good! I always complain that food is gross in Phoenix, but after my first time here.....I can't say that anymore! The spicy catfish is to die for. We ordered a family dinner with mixed regular and spicy catfish. The sides were really good as well! They are friendly, it doesn't take all day for your food to be ready and it is delicious. You have to try it!

wwBUefPeHH2Gj6kgxRBiPw.text: Oh my god. Soooooooo good. My order took a while but it paid in dividends. I had the cod and shrimp, top shelf stuff.

Gms5q463IgWBmgAaIK2hWw.text: Food is good. Only complaint is that their menu board is wrong. It says that you get two sides with the combos, but you only get one.  And service is VERY slow.

KdX2ORiNBdSoZ8oax41FDw.text: Terrible food I wouldn't consider this Southern at all the fish was fried terribly the flavor was horrible we've been here on two different occasions both time my boyfriend got the spicy catfish and I got the regular catfish the first time the catfish was good but the second time both orders tasted terrible I will never return

fFpVuVZfI0k97uD1ROVlZQ.text: Love this place, every time I come I get the spicy catfish nuggets, side and a drink for $5. If you like catfish, then Papa Joe's should be a place you are talking about, theirs is cooked to perfection. Their collard greens will cause you to have regular cravings. Great spot to have in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Catfish nugget..

gTJ1e0dxS7yDXLxtK3-tCQ.text: I love this place. Food is delicious and addicting. Customer service is beyond this world. There is nothing I don't like and I have tried just about everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A must have

yttykKvEpQg8dK2QbHnGOg.text: I have never been disappointed at Joe's. I work near and eat for lunch or take home to my family as much as possible. Try the Cod it is unbelievable!!

gR9hX-vtVisvkS-I7SPKRQ.text: Our first visit won't be our last!  This place is GOOD!  Had catfish & white fish. which were excellent!  Definitely will return to try more! The Okra and coleslaw were equally as good! This place seemed to have lots of regular customers, which says a lot about a place.  :-)   We'll be regulars soon and we're bringing mom with us!

I_rveOZOqTBI7W6Cqx6zOw.text: Tried the catfish and the Mac n Cheese... wonderful  My kid had the pulled Brisket... yep brisket sandwich. YUMMY  Another great day at PJFNQ  PS they have limited Sunday hours but they are open.

2WJQz0CIZQruUkadwlS4Nw.text: That's what it'll be I said to myself as I drove the 20 miles down to the Doctors office from NW Phoenix, Papa Joe's Fish and 'Cue!  I had read the Yelp reviews and had wanted to go for weeks now.  So on the way back from sitting for 30 minutes in an MRI tube, I stopped at what I was sure was going to be a grand slam.  Kind of a rough part of Bethany Home Road but I figured it should be ok and it was, don't let it scare you off.  Walked in and the place was full of people but no one had any food in front of them and since it was nearly 1 PM, I figured everyone is already done with lunch (wrong).  Ordered the brisket sandwich and two sides for around $6.50, reasonable enough and even comes with a drink.  I was order #17.  I waited for my to-go order by the side counter.  After about 10 minutes they called #10 and that was my first red flag.  I thought this could be awhile.  Sure enough a few minutes later they called #11, then #13.  Twenty minutes in they called #8 and it was pretty obvious they lacked institutional restaurant control.  One of the patrons walked up to the counter and asked for his money back, that he couldn't wait anymore.  I asked how long he had been waiting and he said an hour and a half.  At 35 minutes and really late for work I asked for my money back and they said it was coming right out.  Oops, turns out #14 was coming out not #17.  At that point I just walked out with the nice lady behind the counter telling me she would give me my money back.  I just kept walking and will dispute the charge later with AmEx.  They seemed like really nice people, the place was clean, and (supposedly) the food is good.   The questions you have to ask yourself is, "Do I feel lucky?" and "Do I have the disposable time to wait up to 90 minutes for BBQ" -especially when Bobby-Q's is a mile up the road and I can get my meal in under 5 minutes.  Very disappointing.

8UoArySCjY2Rk6MFnPO-9w.text: First of all I want to counter comment the review from Brittney S.  You went to this place 3 times as you stated and I would hope knew it was a Soul Food place... Therefore alot of fried food. They don't offer smothered there either. If you don't like it, don't go... They didn't force you to order fattening item's feel your review was not accurate.   Anyway, we went on Saturday Oct 8th. Being a girl from the South I am always on the look out for good Southern/Soul food places everywhere. There are not too many in the Phoenix area. "Mo" took our order and recommended some items for me. He was nice and very helpful. We also met the owner "Papa Joe" who was very nice and very appreciative of our patronage. I ordered the pulled brisket sandwich, mac and cheese, greens, corn bread and sweet potato pie. The sandwich reminded me of Texas style BBQ. The mac and cheese was creamy and delicious. The greens were seasoned and delicious as well. The corn bread and desert was also equally pleasing.  My boyfriend ordered the ribs, fried okra, jalapeno hush puppies. The sauce on the ribs was tasty and have black pepper in the sauce, the ribs fell apart they were so tender. The okra was not too breaded and was cooked perfect. The hush puppies were great and not spicy hot like one might think. Over all we will go back, it was great food and the staff were nice to us. I do recommend checking this place out if you want a little soul in your hole.....

Cwk-rbeTqVs5wXr1ph8Z0A.text: I really didn't see anything special about this place. We had fried catfish and whiting and fried shrimp that basically tasted like something out of the freezer. Nothing very special or great, maybe a little too greasy even. The fries were bland and the fried okra was okay (nothing compared to what I had in Georgia). Not horrible, just won't be going back again because it wasn't very good.

TkiPk9iGaAPbRft5p_S5zA.text: The last time I went there, and it is the last time, the food was not good at all. overcooked and the spice hand fell hard on the okra and catfish. I ordered no spice and got lots of spice. After I paid for my order, which was an order for 3 people, the owner said to me, my wife didn't charge you for some stuff. I've told her to write so I can read it. OK, rude! Suck it up and deal with your wife. I used to go there a lot and have sent a lot of business there but I feel that this is a business that has plummeted to poor, very poor in service and quality.  I have found MUCH BETTER downtown.

1Eq6bC3Xgvo72DplvW7DDw.text: I Love this Whitting Fish Sandwhich. I order it with Fries and Cole Slaw. Personally I dump Cole Slaw on the Fish Sandwhich and I'm great!

zc8kQoB8qUJywpA4ZbgvmQ.text: I've been to Papa Joe's at least four or five times and have always had great service and food.   They serve up fish, shrimp, ribs, pulled pork, wonderful side dishes like hush puppies and fried okra.  Each time I've been to Papa Joe's I have ordered the one piece spicy catfish (which isn't spicy) and two shrimp. The plate comes with fries, but you can substitute for a different side. I recommend the jalapeno hush puppies. They aren't spicy, like the jalapeno would indicate and are addictively yummy.  I've never had the pulled pork sandwich, but my husband has and says it's really good.   They make home made sweet potatoe pie, which I have yet to try, but I certainly will soon as it looks soooo good.  The people that own Papa Joe's are very friendly and accomodating and aside from the good food the people make it worth coming back.

oonHQzVej1uxXnErZY9zAg.text: MMM MMM MMM that's what I said as I salmmed down my fried whitting, collards and cornbread. Freshly cooked too order so expect to wait. What a gr* spot for soul food. Price ranges from 7-9 bux and you get 2 pcs of fried fish and 2 pcs of shrimp with most fish combos. Delish. Check it out!

XOeT2RE5QDBwNGkvE-IV8w.text: I have been there a couple of times, the food is always very good and lots of it.  I like the two piece cod lunch that includes three shrimp and fries.   Well worth a drive to get there. They also have the normal hamburgers ribs and links.   Give it a try.

_GKmm4j9nyLdDXCNk0b0Vw.text: Had the pulled pork sandwich, fried okra, mac-n-cheese, and sweet potato pie. With a drink the bill came up to under $10. Great food and great prices.

pZJBkmXtvOke_SBZXjx7sw.text: Our experience here was Great !!! Really enjoyed the Spicy Catfish, Mac n cheese, Greens, cornbread and Peach cobbler. Will say this is our fave place to eat Soul Food !!!

U4l7b0-9yah_3mlKzeqFVA.text: I came here based totally on Yelp reviews and really impressed!  I had the original catfish. The fish was hot and fresh and the breading was perfect. Crispy, not hard like at other places in Phoenix. A little stingy with the tartar, though.  The coleslaw was fresh and chilled. Perfect!  For $7, a great lunch.

CoqyHhmyPZkZic6K3JyYmw.text: This is a great find. The sauce isn't my favorite - it's a bit on the peppery side but it's still delicious. The catfish is some of the best I've had. Very clean place and nice people. Good prices too.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AbHpuA2DSIgQv8MAiSmtUQ.text: WOW!...was my first word that came flying out of my mouth..when I walked into Papa Joe's Fish n Que! The homey restaurant is immaculate..and very nicely decorated. Has a warm and nice touch and flare for New Orleans decor. Being a BAMA girl..I love my fried catfish and shrimp..so that is what I tried. After talking to Janet ( her family owns & works Papa Joe's) she told me the catfish is fresh and hand seasoned (to perfection, I might add) They have several catfish and shrimp options...I went with the 3 piece Catfish w/ 4 fried shrimp...it normally comes with french fries, but Janet said I could have my choice of a side instead. Which I opted for because my mouth was already watering for the mac and cheese...I also added a side of turnip greens and a slice of pecan pie. What is really a nice surprise..the cold drink comes with the combo meal..and they threw in a free piece of cornbread, wrapped in a cupcake wrapper. OK...I rolled up my sleeves and dug in!! OH LAWD...the catfish is to die for...perfectly seasoned and fried...3 huge whole catfish fillets, (no half fillets here) Dang! it was so delicious...I had to stop myself from eating the last fillet..cuz, I wanted some for dinner later. The shrimp is just as great..steaming hot and perfectly cooked! The mac n cheese is creamy and cheesy and heart stoppingly addictive..not overcooked and bland. My turnip greens were just glistening in their pot likkor, to which i let my cornbread sop up that delicious elixir..and then when no one was looking..I picked up the bowl and drank with delight the yummy pot likkor from the greens!! I could not stop smiling..while eating my gastronomic delight...it just made me so happy. I just had to meet Rodney (he's Janet's son and was in the front making some fries) and Papa Joe.. ( the owner and names sake) was very friendly..to tell them how delicious their labor of love was!! A very nice, warm and friendly family...where you can tell they put their heart and SOUL..into this wonderful little gem of a Fish n Que joint! I highly recommend the catfish, shrimp, greens, mac n cheese, and pecan pie!! i didn't have my glasses with me..so I couldn't read the full menu..BUT..I know they have some wonderful  BBQ...and maybe next time (if I can get passed that catfish) I will try some of their BBQ'd items! Definitely 2 THUMBS UP and a 5 star review from this satisfied localvor (local) eater!! I will be blogging on my Face book page and sharing Papa Joe's Fish n Que Restaurant! P.s. I only came to know about this gem..through the Living Social Coupon...and I'm so glad I did!! You won't be disappointed!! I"m glad I bought 2 of those Living Social Coupons..I will Definitely be back for more!! Thank you!  EAT LOCAL!!!

Y5HhGmy98krbLrQwjiSzQQ.text: Love  the  Fish...  its all i eat when i stop by... gotta  see bout the ribs and other menu  items...   I appreciate that its African American  owned..  has its own niche location  beside the bowling  alley  area  across the street  from the  hospital  on Bethany Home .

FsQcA4siVBR4pdkQDzwgCQ.text: I picked up some food from Papa Joe's on a Friday night to take home for dinner.  My husband loves ribs...but they were out of ribs so I got him a pulled pork sandwich.  AI ordered the cod and lots of side dishes.  The cod tasted like the oil to cook it was old.  The onion rings and shrimp all had that same old oil taste.  The pulled pork was OK.  The only really tasty item was the coleslaw.  I was so disappointed with this place and won't be going back again.

gb8yjfHD-OnsKcDZtHMJhg.text: I'm a Seattlite (yes, that's really what we call ourselves) who has lived in Arizona for 12 years, searching for good fish and chips.  I finally found the place.  Papa Joe's catfish hit the mark: fresh, flaky, lightly breaded with a bit of spice in the mix, and perfectly cooked.  I'm sooo happy to have found this place.  It is definitely more of a southern type of joint than typical northwestern fish and chips with clam chowder and beer batter.  Papa Joe's instead offers a variety of comfort food sides including sweet potato tots, Mac and cheese, or fried okra. No chowder. They do have a full BBQ menu too, which we didn't try.  3 of us ate well for under $25.  We will definitely go back.

orlvN_lcilpOw-YiulbdOA.text: Papa Joe's is my absolute favorite fish place in Phoenix.  The food is incredible!!

LOQbv2Aw1wL0LUmlo8H68w.text: CATFISH!  After being prompted by a friend to check this place out for months and being in the area, I decided to give it a shot. Although I've enjoyed catfish before, I've never really thought of seeking out a place for it, nor is it something I would usually order. What a fool I've been.   Figured it would an unidentifiable white fish with an overbearing batter to cover up the low quality product... fortunately, I was wrong.  I ordered the 2 piece spicy catfish which comes w a few shrimp and fries.   It took about 10 minutes to get my food which was a good sign since it was obviously going to be fresh. The portion was huge and looked great when I picked it up.   2 really big fish filets w a golden brown crust. When I bit into a piece it was piping hot and the flavor of the fish jumped out. It was really good. The spicy crunch on the outside was awesome and just the right amount. Not too much breading but enough to crisp it up.   Fries were cold as they had been waiting for the fish (thus only 4 stars) and the butterflied fried shrimp with it were great too.   It's a dive for sure and a bit seedy inside (these 2 me are positive traits) and will be back for sure.   There was another guy there who said he has been eating at Papa Joe's every Friday for a year....I asked what else he has had and he looked at me like I was crazy. Said, "I've had the catfish and there is no reason to eat anything else ever"   I can't say that I disagree with him. Go and don't be sneaky...order the catfish and enjoy.

V4uWyZ1at5kg4QzpFXre8Q.text: Let's just say... When living social came out with coupons, I bought 4. I get the spicy catfish every time and the jalapeno hush puppies are very good. Its another small business that you guys can support and feel good about because they deserve the business.  If you eat there, you will probably smell like the food they make. It used to be a Quiznos so the atmosphere could put some people off. Just order it to go and you will not be disappointed.

cUDrf_S7uu9BidEL2yD_nw.text: Very friendly place on a casual Saturday noon. This place is clean and tidy. The order was ready in a reasonable time.   The recommended catfish was wonderful in taste and texture. The spicy version is harmless. The beautiful 8" filet is covered in a crispy seasoned fish fry crust disguising the white tender juicy and flakey catfish. It had the qualities of freshly caught seafood. Without prior knowledge of jalapeno hushpuppies, they came as a fantastic discovery!   The 5" cod had the same great seasonings but couldn't compete with the catfish in that juicy fresh taste. The oil used tasted clean and new. The cornbread was simple as cornbread could be. The quality butterfly shrimp is a great accompaniment. If you give the lemonade a chance, you may detect the cozy hint of honey. I will visit again.

8lB4VXPSQODvIs5bdvmtTw.text: First time trying Papa Joe's we'll see how it is...  For the price it's really hard to beat Papa Joe's  I had catfish, shrimp and okra, all fried along with macaroni & cheese. The catfish, shrimp and okra were all good. Actually the fried okra was really good, who knew you could get fried okra in Arizona? The macaroni & cheese was nothing special, I probably won't get it again but I will definitely be back.

LXUqh6WA9J1xfKgubIIJ4g.text: Oh, yeah, this is the good stuff!! Best catfish in town!!

Gzo35RJzgN-wz_c_9Y5lXw.text: I tried this place for the first time and it's pretty good. Spicy cod and the fried okra was amazing.  The only down fall is the tartar sauce isn't homemade! I didn't like that it came out of a packet. Overall I will go back.

LUkcI7nDKT4mVWpXaTLp6g.text: Delicious fish, fried okra is perfect.  Very friendly and fast service.

0GiJQI_Q7sb4dir2vuP5vA.text: This place is amazing!  I decided to try it one day because it is right by my work, and I have been hooked ever since!  Some of the best soul food around this side of town!  Personal favs: spicy catfish (which by the way you can now get in nugget style!), mac-n-cheese, and their beans (which are a combo between ranch style beans and sweet beans; I can't even begin to describe the mouth watering flavor).  I always ask for my catfish extra spicy because their regular spicy batter doesn't cut it for me; they never object!  Food is consistently ranked for HIGH QUALITY.

KcocniRYYjUvgDnisjXQSA.text: First time visit. Interior is plain and old, but clean. Service is mediocre at best and it does take quite a while to get your food after ordering. I had the catfish and shrimp basket with mac n cheese. Food was fresh and hot. Not bad overall, but a little pricey for what you get. Doubt I will return.

sBhf3PersqHTUIJcH_I_LA.text: you wont leave hungry the portions are perfect and the fish is really tasty(On Point!!!) but the greens and the mac and cheese needed a little help, next time I'll stick to fries

mTLDOFcmxrzgfrYm8Mkv1A.text: I went here a couple days ago with my roommate cuz we saw the great reviews on here and we live just down the street. Good idea. for just over $10 I got the burger combo and he got a cheeseburger. We could tell that the burgers were made fresh to order not frozen and thrown on a grill or re-heated. It was a nice big burger, and was delicious with lettuce, tomato, and would be onion except that he's allergic. And pickles. Ketchup and mustard plus they had bottles of ketchup that you could add if you so desired. My combo came with two sides and a drink, which they had a soda fountain as well as a lemonade fruit punch and grape kool-aid option. I chose potato salad and sweet potato tater-tots. the potato salad was in a separate bowl and was good. The sweet potato tater tots on the other and blew me away. they were simply amazing. there was a lot of them as well. Totally worth the $10. Prolly be back more often.

5J5eE7w-nNDxX5tH1W3adQ.text: Being from the SF Bay Area I know great Seafood when I have it. This place is up there. I have been enjoying the Catfish for some years now. It is the best I have found in Phoenix. I have tried to find places that remind me of the Great food in the (Oakland) Bay Area. Being here in wonderful Phoenix (Being Land Locked) Fresh Fish is a challenge to say the least. I can be sure when I leave Papa Joe's I am full and Happy. The Owner and his wife make you feel like family.  You can't get better than that. At least the part of the family they still like......

hri1uFsNv7q0PfIpy2h01A.text: Joes has the best fried fish in Phoenix. Good prices,i feel that i get a large amount of food for what i pay, other places charge an arm and a leg for what joes gives you. Go with the catfish,its what they do best. Hushpuppies are amazing as well.

JgcnVGDmKFZbDoNdJ4uk8w.text: 1st time here and everything excellent! Had the spicy catfish, shrimp & fried okra. Batter was light and not too greasy at all.   Catfish was easily the best I've ever had and the okra had a light spice, real subtle flavour and so delicious!  People working were real friendly and helpful, & cook served up my order with a genuine smile.   Definitely going back!

IWszOKkdvG6abqZp7dPuhg.text: Well if you're reading this you must care about what your dining on right? We just had the best fish in 35 years in the valley, tops Papadeaux's and all of the high-end Scottsdillian aquatic eateries and it's on 20th ave and Bethany Home !, been there for 5.5 years, Mom and Pop place,great pricing and service, but all the food ,cod ,catfish and the shrimp tasted like it was just caught and cooked up just for you to enjoy. The reviews I write seem to be well recieved ,I can be trusted to tell it like it is ,no holds barred, food is VERY important to me.

y69Ghfun1TqC-9fUeyEGQg.text: My family and I were driving to a restaurant located near Papa Joe's but it happened to be closed. We had no idea where we were going but saw Papa Joe's in passing and decided to give it a try. This was the best thing we could have done. Absolutely great customer service. They are just down to earth folks and their food was delicious. My wife had spicy cod, my children had the hamburger and french fries and I had the spicy catfish. Everyone was delighted. Got the mac and cheese /Mac and cheese smelled horrible and  Tasted  just as horrible. Cheapest fries u can buy. Oh and the shrimp. Its that crap u get in the freezer section at your local grocery store. I want my husband's money back but it too far to drive

5ttJHO-ibrCrXRv4O1N1xQ.text: All the reviews you read and see are pretty much spot on. I've been doing a tour of local fried fish spots here in town and there was no point in trying anywhere else when I ate at Papa Joe's. The fish is perfectly cooked and seasoned. The prices are great. The sides are incredible (especially the fried okra). I've only had the bbq pulled pork sandwhich but the bbq is very solid as well. Go to Joe's, the best fried fish spot in Phx.

ck1WeRqKCc_qTZzwh67Uog.text: I cannot come out and say this any clearer or directly than I am about to: I love this place, and the man (Papa Joe) and his family who own and operate it. I have been frequenting Papa Joe's for over a year now and since moving to Phoenix in 2012. In that time, I have never had a bad meal, either quality or service wise...and only awesome experiences talking with Papa Joe, his lovely wife, and all of the customers who, like me, value awesome soul food and atmosphere alike. I am always assured of a smiling face, and someone (in Papa Joe) who values and appreciates me for more than just being a paying customer. Also, and this speaks more to Papa Joe as a person than a business owner/operator, this is the only place around where one can count on a heapin' helpin' of spiritual wisdom and comfort on top of their fish and chips or ribs.   My staple meal is the 2 or 3 piece cod with french fries and cole slaw. Of course, the meal also comes with a drink and butterflied fried shrimp too. The portions are hearty and filling, and the food is always fresh and tasty. The oil they use to fry in is changed regularly, and results in fish and chips that are light and clean, and the fries especially are always fried to perfection. They also have a non-carbonated drink station now, including lemonade, grape and fruit punch drinks, which reminds me of the South and the original soul food movement in so many ways that my mouth waters and heart aches that I am not writing this from there with a cold drink in my hand! My favorite is taking the lemonade and grape drink in the cup together, and the entire meal compliments itself and my palate so wonderfully.   I have also had the ribs, and other menu items, and love them all, but return for the fish and chips almost weekly or at least when my wallet can afford it. But more than anything else, I return to support Papa Joe, his family and business--because they all treat me and make me feel like one of their own time and again, without reserve or fail.   I am not going to slight or judge any Yelpers who have left negative reviews of either the atmosphere or quality of food Papa Joe's serves... to each their own and everyone is entitled to their opinions, just as am I. However and as someone who has lived in and traveled to so many different states and countries outside of America even, and has sampled the cuisine in so many locales that I cannot even count--I believe Papa Joe's Fish and Que to be a cut above the rest when one is seeking the physical and spiritual comfort and satiation of a True soul food experience in the heart of the Valley of the Sun.   My hope is that you will try them and feel the same... and become a member of the family with your first and every visit thereafter:-).

NsxQ-5DZfh1Zi7Mc8JYZVw.text: This place is a hole in the wall but it's delicious! Not oily and the batter was seasoned nicely especially on the okra. The shrimp are small but you have your choice of how many pieces of each you want. The cocktail sauce was delicious also.  My only complaint is it's cash only so I had to run back home to get money and the service was VERY slow. Otherwise i would've given them 5 stars. Next time I will call it in before I head down there.  I have to say that the staff was exceptionally friendly and even the customers sitting around waiting for their food was very friendly. I've never had so many strangers talking to me, it was cool!

Come on guys

Omjj0ThGO5jjRkJBQC0DoQ.text: I've been here a couple of time and love each time. The spicy catfish sandwich is the best. The owner is very friendly. And he'll be honest if you ask hi. For recommendations. Also, you can't beat the fact that they provide red koolaid. Pretty awesome.

32WWaWhp82rGjHLS3g-P8A.text: OMG.....my taste buds are on fire....that fried catfish tho.....so bomb tho....I got three and there so big.....crispy tender right spice....good job

iB1ud6BFYp1sD3ETVowqbg.text: Update: 8/8/17 I tried their 2 Pc beef ribs with jalapeno hush puppies & cornbread.  Equally as good.  You don't even need the sauce, whatever their rub is..was very flavorful.  Decided to drive in early for bowling so I can give this place a try.  Seen & passed by for years when in this area.  I ordered the 1 piece cod w/sweet potato tater toys (combo incl. 2 fried shrimp) and I added a piece of spicy catfish.  Everything was seasoned well, good size portions, lightly breaded, Not Greasy and cooked perfectly.  They also serve BBQ meats, but I did not try that this time.  It's located in a strip mall next to the bowling alley.  Parking is limited, depending on the time of day you come.  The place is a small mom & pop place with about 8 tables.  The lady is very cordial.  Definitely check this place out and I would come back again!

ShOjRG_ifWJ0uu8RYGtmhA.text: I've been to Papa Joe's maybe 4x. I loved the 2 piece cod. On the 4th time the batter on fish and onion rings were a little raw, I didnt complain. Today I went and got home and this time it taste burnt, as much as I hate driving I thought just eat it. Well I called to let them know, he said bring it back I want you to eat. photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kFqYj6gBumSIR01Em_ZyhA.text: I finally had an opportunity to try out this place after hearing more than a few people bring it up, so for lunch today my family and I decided to check it out.  THIS is not the "dine in" spot. This is a "get your food and eat it at a stoplight" place. Seating is limited, and it is hot as the fish grease in there. My guess is that the place has a swamp cooler, which is no match for 96 degrees and 40% humidity and a 66degree dew point... Call ahead and take your time getting there. Our order took 45 minutes to get to the table.  Service was good, and the staff was courteous. No complaints there, so let's get down to the real reason we came... The food... I've read the reviews of others and wonder how many of the people giving 5 stars actually know how to cook. If you know your way around the kitchen and your pallet is set to good food and good quality, you won't like this place at all. The food picture on the website is NOT the food that came out of that kitchen today...  In fact, keep driving past this place and find yourself a Mandy's or a Pete's and you'll fair a whole lot better. My wife got the three piece catfish, which came with three shrimp. She choose the baked beans potato salad as a side. One shrimp in and she passed it to me. Not only was it some pre-breaded shrimp (which most places serve) but it was a low quality (like not restaurant grade) and tasted as if it was thawed and re-frozen or poorly stored. Terrible. The fish also appeared to be some pre-breaded frozen variety that was a half-step below Gorton's Fish Sticks.  I got the hot link sandwich because four ribs for $16.42 was pretty steep tome seeing as how Famous Dave's has four bones for $14.99 that comes with two sides and a cornbread.  When I drove around the back of the building there was no grill and no smoke coming out of anywhere, and I wasn't paying for any one's boiled/oven browned ribs. The hotlink was hot and flavorful but they're small and they're cut down the center like your grandma used to do weenies when you were 7, and crisscrossed on a hamburger bun. Tip: Get a bigger hotlink, keep the bun. People will eat it with plain white bread if it's right.  Fries were lackluster, just plan shoestrings. They could sprinkle a little Cajun spice (on them to give them a little more flair. The person who go it the worst was my daughter. She ordered a pulled pork sandwich that consisted of a scoop of dry pork with a dollop of bbq sauce in the middle of it. Needless to say, that went straight in the trash...  I still don't understand what took 45 minutes... Maybe they only have one microwave...

KXZFud_7_zvlgC-SdB_VQg.text: Let me start off by saying that I'm a Southern girl and when you say Soul Food I expect it to be prepared a certain way. I consider Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que to be a fail attempt at Soul Food. I had the Catfish, Potato Salad, and Corn Bread. I prefer my catfish to be fresh as well as my shrimp. I also prefer my fish to be fried in corn meal. My fish tasted like it was straight from the freezer and just put in flour and dumped in the deep fryer. Not seasoned at all. The shrimp that came with the fish was absolutely disgusting it tasted like batter and grease. They didn't even bother to put any type of seasoning on it. The potato salad tasted like pickled potatoes. It was super sour. I don't know how you mess up cornbread but they managed to do so. The cornbread tasted like stale batter. It's obvious that they were cutting corners so I can't wrap my head around why it took 30 minutes to get my food. I'm giving this 2 stars because the people were nice and the place was clean. Other than that, Subpar at most. I don't recommend this to anyone who loves soul food and know how it's suppose to taste.

RWqJZrdDUk9b8IyuzUlyRg.text: best catfish in town, taste as if he poured butter all over it after it was fried.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loving the fish, and shrimp in every order

AeD_M_7v9FkHgUYwJhphNQ.text: The folks who run this place are really sweet! I tried the fried shrimp and mac and cheese first visit. Shrimp was crunchy and just spicy enough. Mac and cheese was yummy gooey and creamy. I could see the real cheddar in there!  Second trip I tried the brisket sandwich, fried okra, and cornbread. Very generous pile of tender brisket was great, but I am not a huge fan of the vinegary bbq sauce. Just a personal preference, but I prefer it sweeter. Fans of the sassy vinegar bbq will probably love it. I love that the fried okra was a bit spicy; nice touch. Next time I will request it extra crispy. The bits that were a bit burned tasted heavenly. Cornbread was perfectly sweet, fluffy, moist and corny.  Washed down with their delicious lemonade. I will definitely be back to sample other menu items. I love that its a mom and pop as I like to support local businesses especially when they go out of their way to make you feel welcome!

zuNWfv2nwpbiqYFiJH1DJg.text: Been coming here for 5 yrs and it has never disappointed. It's family owned and ran and the food is always so darn good! This is my "go-to" place for friends and family if they've never had it before.

3WGxbpJCS2jIhoejpPB6sg.text: I've come  to notice that the places with the best god are the little hole in the wall spots. My biz partner and I lucked up when we yelped this place to eat before we hit the road for a 6 hr trip. As soon as we walked in a older, heavy set African American man was sitting behind the counter. He appeared to be chewing something in his mouth and had that cliche southern style look. I loved it, we ordered the catfish and cod with fried shrimp on side. I must say they were delicious. Good service with good food always speaks volumes in my book.  I'm not sure if the fried fish cooked by African American people was so good because they're great cold or because I'm biased because it's Black history month. Never the less, two thumbs up.

ZR5Zp1L-3UV0sj8F_TvFFw.text: If your looking for some good tasting fried catfish come to this place. I had the catfish and shrimp basket.  The portion size of the catfish was big sized.  I also had the peach cobbler to go, it was tasty. I'm most definitely going back and trying other things.

nNMoFzxCa2tLPJBpqSLLIg.text: The best soul food restaurant Phoenix has to offer. The staff here is just awesome I had the spicy catfish and BBQ ribs dinner.

V40sGnTEPOTLJ1KRsqVu4Q.text: Beat fried okra ever and their catfish is amazing!!  The greens were a little bit bland and the Mac N' Cheese was just good,  not great...their ribs are pricey...but big and tender.  It is our new go to spot for excellent catfish and ribs.

0-cL9YZJtgv4PPJC3T_-QA.text: After all the good reviews I read for Papa Joe's, I was really looking forward to some fried catfish and fried okra. I was disappointed. The fish was rubbery, as was the fried okra.  The peach cobbler was in a little container and was cold. I won't be back again.

bRZa3f98Nzq4BfzOI1gVLg.text: Papa Joe's is an excellent restaurant if you're looking for delicious fried fish.  If you're interested in ambiance, service, or frills, you should stay away.  The catfish sandwich is a great deal ($3.89).  The fish was well breaded and crispy (not soggy or oily).  The absolutely best thing on the menu is the fried Okra.  Even if you don't generally like okra, you should give it a try.  The breading they use is spicy and fantastic!  I think they close at 7 PM, so don't try to come for dinner!

cpNWd8acSpcfRFA4wvVB5Q.text: Papas joes fish n Q. It's been over a year and I still miss the catfish that I ate there. For me it was the best food I ever ate. Plus the staff is great. I miss you guys and can't wait to come back again. Your truly Eric Figueroa.

x1Ycl6ggZ_nLO2F35JMZEQ.text: My husband and I just had their cod fish and chips with shrimp and it was easily the best we've ever had. The owners were very friendly and still served us even though it was after 7:30 pm and they close at 8. We will make the 45 minute drive every time we want fish and chips for as long as we live in AZ.

ARkYJesxIqGKVQvPZOwZQA.text: Now this is what 5-stars food is like. Its so so so good. I often get the 2 cat fish combo with shrimp and huskpuppies. Man. the white sauce, i think hoisomething... Again not very healthy food but you know...you might die the next day so whatever.

7NCoM1fZ5YiGMs1fXaXr6g.text: What - you want fried fish - COME HERE!!!  Cannot tell you how friggen good this fish is. Their menu has different kinds of you can choose from like whiting, cod, catfish and each order comes with 2 fried shrimp.  The fried is lightly breaded & crispy fried - not heavy drowned in batter fried. Food is reasonably priced and the folks there are super nice.  Support the locals and visit if you are in the mood for fried fish or even wings cause they got them too!!  Much love to Papa Joe's!

Vpolyzt2_5jXYdBQArg1CA.text: Spicy Catfish was good. I tried the fried okra and although it wasn't bad I won't be going for that side again. Just not my thing. Staff was a bit distant but that may be due to just finishing the lunch rush. It's hard to find good catfish in Phoenix so I will be giving Papa Joe's another shot.

QJQsYG8BGPv1JhquFZSxaA.text: I really wasn't in the mood for some fast food so we quickly Yelped a fish place this restaurant came up nice little establishment I ordered the cod spicy with some shrimp took a few minutes as they prepped it fresh was nice and hot, tasted pretty damn good along w a splash of lemon , unlimited drinks at the soda fountain, I will com back to try the catfish n whiting fish next time

7GYowfyOg5duJ3SUdd6K6A.text: Finally got a chance to stop in and check it out.  Got the catfish cod and hush puppies.  Overall the atmosphere was okay, nothing special.  The food was good.  First time I've ever had good catfish.  All the ones I've had before were always really oily with a unique taste.  This one was soft and dry(not oily) with a nice breading.  The cod had a good breading but was dry on the inside.  Unlike other reviews, I wasnt too impressed with the jalapeno hush puppies.  The tarter sauce was good tho.  I did find it kinda wierd that although they had their fountain drink out in the dining room, they had a sign that said 50 cent refills, never saw that before.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mL5lRmKC2tum47l8um8agA.text: Ahh, this place makes me think of "Coming to America" with Eddie Murphy.... "Just let your soul glow... just let it shine through!!!"  This is some of the best soul food in town.  My usual staple for soul food has traditionally been Lo Lo's Chicken and Waffles, but I know that if I'm looking for fish and chips, I'm coming to Papa Joe's.     I had the 2 piece spicy catfish and shrimp; the portions are generous, the catfish is wonderful -- he uses a real light breading on the catfish and a thicker, crunchier breading on the shrimp.  I like the that the catfish was reasonably mild in flavor, although he has an option for spicy breading.   Standard fare includes fries, although I opted for the jalapeno hush puppies, which did not disappoint.      The shady neighborhood and bullet holes in the windows add a nice touch to give you that authentic experience as well.

nLol4udeL8NrQBDlerwgSg.text: Wanted to try southern food this week so I decided to make my way to Papa Joe's Fish N Que. Upon entering I noticed that the design of the restaurant was pretty neat. I had trouble finding out where the menu was at first, found it was posted near the door, which I thought was an odd choice. Finally settled with something simple. Catfish with fries and fried shrimp, spicy. Placed my order...waited...waited...waited. For only one other group of people it took about 20 minutes to finally get my food. For somewhere with an emphasis on lunch hours, it sure took awhile. Sat down and started on my meal. Catfish was buried under all my fries so I felt compelled to eat most of the fries first. Personally, I found them bland. It's possible that other people prefer fries this way, but I just found it tasteless. Went for the fried shrimp. Pretty good especially dipped in the cocktail sauce. Lastly, had the catfish which was good. Was juicy and cooked well. Fell apart on my fork which increased the difficulty in eating. Also, I noticed nothing spicy about the catfish. Bummer. I love seafood but I've had better, way better, but I'm guessing for the price it makes sense.   All in all it was...ok. I was really underwhelmed especially after reading all the rave reviews. Of course I'm basing this off one item on menu but that's the experience I had. I just feel there is nothing at this particular place that is unique or above and beyond anywhere else with similar food and style. Not bad, but I probably wouldn't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qnR36QU7QQukkQPkrz3PYw.text: My boyfriend & I are both fans of BBQ. He is especially picky but I can understand because his Dad makes the best BBQ and homemade sauce I have ever had. That being said, Papa Joe's is delicious. We have never had a bad experience and have been coming here for a while. The pulled pork or pulled chicken are my personal favorites. If you go later in the day there is a good chance the pulled pork will be gone, that's a good sign in my book. He normally gets the ribs & has never complained. Their fried okra is good as well the batter has the perfect spices in it.  I have suggested Papa Joe's to several friends; its small & the people are friendly!

They only take cash but prices very reasonable.

HYt4grARP_A2toFHG9baRg.text: First time here, ordered food to go. Place is a family owned business located at the end of a strip mall. Early Saturday afternoon and it was still busy. Main choices are BBQ or Fried Fish. There are many options and sides. Opted for the pulled brisket combination with jalopeno hush puppies and cole slaw with a fountain drink.  The pulled brisket was very good, served on a hambuger bun. You can add their BBQ sauce or hot sauce and again there are options. The brisket was flavorful and juicy and a very generous portion. I would order that again any day. BBQ sauce that we tried had a vinegar base   Not too impresed with the jalopeno hush puppes. Small size nuggets but not spicy for my taste. Searched but could not find the jalopeno. The cole slaw was good, it had a mayo base.   Will be back to try the fried catfish with greens and okra. You can call in your order and take it home or dine in. A filling and flavorful lunch.

K0oVHVy1VjdPmVM3IC6PZg.text: Papa Joe, I guess the gentleman who greeted me was PJ, was kinda Southern sweet. He helped me decide what to order, as it was my first time there.
