7BKMTb7nleQcAW8-SFyeng.text: A hole in the wall place you can eat at before you hit the mall or Harkins at Christown in an area of town with few good eat choices. Kind of an eclectic menu with a few fried fish choices and some BBQ options. I got a turkey burger and it was just okay. It was not great nor was it bad. Three stars for good. It had mustard on it which kind of ruined it for me. It had a lot of mustard on it as in they poured the whole jar on it. yuk! I do not like mustard on burgers at all and it seemed odd on a Turkey Burger. But I have to admit I can not remember if the menu mentioned that and I could have brought it back if I wanted to. However, I scarfed it down since I had not eaten all day and our movie was starting soon. Soooooo, I take that as a "my fault" type of hit. Well, except they should probably not put that much on it. Next time I will try another dish.   I did taste some other foods. The Jalapeno Hush puppies are good but again not five stars or anything.  The sweet potato pie is also tasty. Again three star for a good place to go.   I am still not sure about the five star reviews here. I am not staying it is bad place at all. It is a solid place to go if you want a fried platter. It is just not a five star place. There are way better BBQ otions and fish in town. Also, The staff could be a bit friendlier. They were kind of rude.

NO5iSpznLbQKHlFqQLobhg.text: Hubby and I stopped for a late lunch at Papa Joe's.  We both ordered the two piece catfish with three fried shrimp.  He got spicy, I did not.  He got fries, I got Mac n cheese.  The food was SO good and there was plenty of it.  The catfish was perfectly cooked, not too greasy, and seasoned to perfection.  All for under $20 ( which included drinks).  The service is very friendly and the place is clean.  We will DEFINITELY be back!!

Cg8_NWoPA19cV7-cUYjYdg.text: So I was craving some fried fish and decided to try this place out.  OMG this place is by far the best fried fish in Phoenix.  I definitely recommend this place.  It is decently priced and the fish fillets are huge.  They are perfectly breaded and those jalapeno hush puppies are ridiculously delish.

DFte2RO8IAKbB-FU6BrR6w.text: Every time we visit Phoenix, we try some new food places...it's always a shot in the dark except for Yelp reviews. This evening, after a 475 mile drive from Santa Fe, we tried PaPa Joe's.   PaPa Joe's is on a major East/West street not too far northwest of the central downtown area...about a 10 minute drive from 3rd and Thomas in moderate traffic.  The restaurant is in a small strip center that is loaded with active small businesses. The neighborhood is busy light commercial. Parking could have been a challenge but not this time, I pulled into the lot and had a spot immediately right at the restaurant entrance. Easy access.  The place is friendly, easy going, clean and neat. The menu is on the wall and includes a large variety of BBQ meats, fish and shrimp as well as a good selection of side dishes. It's order at the register, serve yourself when your number is called and bus it afterwards. The menu is also available on line and includes items not mentioned here...we were after BBQ and catfish. Comfortable setting.  With the idea of sharing our meals, she ordered a three rib combo with two sides while I had a two piece catfish combo with three shrimp and a side. My side was fried okra and hers were greens and sweet potatoes...There was plenty of food. We each had iced tea to drink. Less than five minutes after ordering, our food was out of the kitchen. It was presented in styro carry out boxes. The catfish was almost too hot to eat, crispy on the outside, moist and steamy on the inside. The fried okra was pretty typical of commercial fried okra and was tasty and hot. Her ribs were Kansas City style, quite large and meaty, tender and well cooked, the greens were home style, hot, tender and tasty...soft but not overcooked. The sweet potatoes were like Tater Tots, but as the rest, hot, tasty and cooked just right. Joe's BBQ sauce is a good combo of sweet and spicy unlike many that are poorly balanced and detract from the meat by overpowering it. There was plenty of sauce with the ribs but not too much. Good food, good portions.  While we were waiting for our food, I struck up a conversation with a fellow watching football on the wall mounted TV. It was PaPa Joe. He's a personable fellow but after a brief chat, had to get back to the kitchen...I wanted to talk some more but they were busy with the Saturday evening procession of carry out and eat in diners. Friendly.  $19.80 out the door...I did leave a tip in addition. In my opinion, a bargain given the good food, friendly atmosphere and fast service. I would go back and I would recommend it to a friend.

i8G7s5OnouvfBp8SRWWSsA.text: Was great food. loved the fried fish and Okra. The staff very friendly.  My only problem was, I was the only white person in the place. The two young African American sitting next to me, were saying unbelievable racist rants about white people , not to themselves but very loud so I could hear it. The whole place heard it. No management intervened. Made me very uncomfortable and I will not go back.

Mp5l5_sHqy_ZEYXAuojFZA.text: I have been to Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que only once, so I have only had a few things off of their menu to eat. Having said that, I don't feel that I can give as extensive of a review as I normally would. I got the pulled brisket sandwich, sweet potato tater tots, and jalapeno hushpuppies and everything I put in my mouth was delicious! The atmosphere wasn't that great, but I don't really go to restaurants for the atmosphere (and besides, I got my order to go anyway). I definitely plan on going back as soon as I can (I'm a poor grad student with very little free time) and I plan on ordering something else off of their wonderful-looking menu!

9BoAtGEVjgXF4CO-a4Y6bQ.text: Papa Joe's makes catfish the way it should be made - non-fishy, non-greasy, with a perfectly seasoned and light crust.  Good greens, good mac 'n' cheese, great jalapeno hushpuppies.  If you want catfish - this is certainly the spot to be.  I also tried a bite of the pulled pork which I thought was passable (the vinegar based bbq sauce was, however, marvelous) but not anywhere in the same league as the catfish.

q3TrJ493BwPBJ0kNyMXMeQ.text: Calling all catfish lovers!!! You can order it spicy, (which I like), or regular but either one will be crisp yet super moist and tender on the inside. Don't worry about needing any sauce because it's full of flavor on it's own but they are available if you like.

uZ_fp8JnxGIkZz8VvciX0Q.text: Hands down Papa Joe has the best greens in the Phoenix metro area. Coming from Georgia, I know my greens! The catfish had a light cornmeal coating and was scrumptious. I would definitely order it again. The area was a little scary and intimidating but Papa Joe made us feel comfortable by greeting us at the door. He was very hospitable to my mother and me. If we are ever in the area again we will come back for more of Papa Joe's fixins!!

I love this place!  Service was great too.  The owner seems like a great guy and truly makes everyone walking in the door feel immediately at home.  If you are anywhere near here, don't miss out.  Note: It's got a small store front, blink and you'll miss it. And missing it would simply be awful.

uYDDQzqU_ktcVwc9K5GobQ.text: I gave this place a try and I was not disappointed! I had the catfish nuggets and they were awesome. The breading was thin and crispy, but I ordered spicy and it was not even medium spice. I hope they just made a mistake when they battered them. I also had the sweet potato tater-tots and they were great!

RZe30ok3Y6JsCW81_u1XWA.text: This is my 2nd time here in 2 day's. The fish here is off the hook. I have tried the whiting and cod. I preferred the whiting. The shrimp that comes with combo is delicious as well. And the sweet potato pie was a nice treat to finish up my meal. Next time I will try the BBQ.

F9oC52yZpck68Jbnlmaz2w.text: Omg this is the best spicy catfish nuggets,Mac & cheese and fried okra ever. I will definitely go back and let friends know about papa joes. Prices are not out of line with the amount of food you get. Excellent

yn4_8Cd400DLzH1dw0uZSA.text: OMG! What a find. Southern Fried Fish and BBQ just the way I like it. Been meaning to stop by and try this place for almost a year and now I'm kicking myself for not stopping sooner. The catfish was fried and seasoned perfectly in cornmeal. Okra and onion rings were perfect. The only place I can get fish like this at Hush Puppies in Vegas or in LA.

YJwukOOAJ-kPPelfri7YfQ.text: Our first visit was tonite. We both had the cod with onion rings, the wife had potato salad while I had the cole slaw. All of it was pretty good. The menu is on the wall. You order and pick up your own food at the counter

xZB5ESp2rvno7swJqceV9g.text: I have driven by this place for the past year and always wondered if it was any good or not. Stopped in today for lunch and have a pulled chicken sandwich that came with two sides and a drink and a piece of pecan pieoffer less than $10. The sandwich was tasty and the chicken was moist. The slaw was creamy and the sweet potato tater tot's were a nice addition to the meal. Even the P con pie was very tasty. I will definitely go back to try more

sxOILNRdpnUQzXitq5aHoQ.text: I was really craving some fish and chips and don't get me wrong. It was good. The only thing I did not like was the fact that they didn't have lemons or good hot sauce. They gave me a lemon packet because lemons are too expensive he said. Which I wouldn't have mind paying for a fresh lemon.

Czo7kOUWtC-EyspJFyHrEw.text: A classic southern style mom and pop joint.Decor and dining is far from special but the food and customer service is excellent.The owner is friendly and "grandad" like.My favorite is the fried whiting which is extremely hard to find in the western part of the country.Sides are good and ribs and chicken are good but probably not the traditional "slow and low wood smoke" that would put this restaurant over the top.That being said whenever I'm in this part of town I try to stop in!

d3xz3uP8iNp09t1H0qBOLQ.text: Let me start with the restaurant itself....it's CLEAN!  Second, the service- superb! They are extremely friendly and informative. I can't recall the last time I had such stellar service! Finally, the food- delicious! As a long time knock kneed lobster customer- searching for something a little closer and a little less $$- this is it.  I had the spicy cod and shrimp- perfect. Greens- fantastic. Fried okra- also perfect. Cocktail sauce also prepared just right. Husband had the spicy whiting which he loved along with the Mac n cheese and Cole slaw, all fantastic. We will definitely be back!

OLXkcKM-8PW7EdN2Y-Hd6g.text: Wasn't the worst I've ever tasted but I don't think it was worth the $45 I spent either. The Mac $ cheese & baked beans are tasteless. I expected the fish to be fried in corn meal but instead I'm pretty sure it was fried in flour. You can tell everything is fried in the same oil which is fine as long as it's clean. I'm definitely not a fan of the barbque sauce, not very much flavor. My boyfriend enjoyed the wings and the greens are also pretty good. Needless to say we won't be returning here.

JZ0O5mTQp8hpb_hVuVsZ8g.text: Can't tell you how many times I have passed by this place! I'm glad I didn't the night I stopped in. This area lacks fish and chip spots so I'm happy I found one!   They have quite the variety of things to order. I ordered the spicy whiting with french fries. The fish was perfectly cooked, crispy, and flaky. The fries I didn't care for unfortunately and I couldn't tell that my order was the spicy version. I would have preferred the fish to have some kind of kick to it.   I definitely want to come back though and order other items off the menu. Wish it was in a different area since parking is limited.   This might be my new favorite spot in the area. Everyone working there was very nice and you get a very homely feeling when you walk in.  If they made changes to the fries and the spicy issue it would be closer to a five star rating. Restaurants with great fried fish are hard to find out in Arizona so I'm glad I was able to find this spot.

WzINw1HaCAnL3p7229-Owg.text: Went here because of Yelp reviews.  I was not disappointed.  The spicy catfish was very good. Not impressed with the french fries. I will go back to try some of the other menu items. Restaurant was clean and the folks there friendly.

TEn64q-5gE25oxxhh8acZA.text: Definitely a stop here whenever I'm West Valley.  Good Customer service and really nice staff.  Catfish nuggets and greens are my favorite.

PwTaMhrb90xXZ17BOpZsXQ.text: What a disater and a wasre of 1 hour. Ordered the fried cod spicy and 3 shrimp with a side of fried okra. Ten minutes after I ordered I added 1 pork rib which was $3.00, wow. Ten minutes later my rib arrived without my fish. The rib was 1/2 cold and 1/2 hot, definately microwaved. The rib wss tough as leather and dificult to get off the bone. Another 10 minutes passed and I asked about the fish. They finally located it and in 10 minutes it arrived. The small filets were only partially breaded and were mushy. Rather than the fresh fis I expected, they brought back my childhood nightmares of frozen fish sticks. The shrimp were boxed frozen and tastless. The saving grace was the fried okra was ok and the elderly order taker did offer a free desert for the long wait. I declined as I just wanted out of there.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rrib. Wow $3.00 for 1 rib! Better be great at that price. Definately microwaved and undetcooked. Darnit.

RnmGwWfwGBYCbJehxnWzwA.text: Located in an old Quiznos, this is great food for a great value! Very low prices, everything was fried and delicious. Try the spicy catfish in strips or nuggets with sides of sweet potato tots, fried okra and jalapeno hush puppies. We waited 20 minutes for our food, but it was worth the wait. The lemonade is delicious! The decor leaves much to be desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Catfish nuggets are the best! With sweet potato taters :)
Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy catfish with fried okra. Deelish!

pU0KXprY_5FVbnsXVN36SQ.text: It's been a year since I've eaten here but I'm writing the review now because I FINALLY remembered what this place was called! My dad broke his neck the night before his wedding last year and was taken to Phoenix Baptist so we were looking for food nearby. We walked over here and were a little weary. However, this place is AMAZING. We ended up bringing extra food to the entire wedding party at the hospital so thank you Papa Joes for unknowingly catering the wedding!!   I'll be making another trip here soon since I remembered what it was called ;) despite the 12 mile drive - soooo worth it!

SzdDA3IX0ga1cQF9JUSyXQ.text: I came here on a whim and boy I am happy I did. I tried half and half spicy and regular catfish nuggets. The seasoning was perfect, the outside was nice and crunchy while the inside was super tender. Could definitely tell it was fresh, and would definitely recommend it to all of my friends.

L0IqlZw_Kwaq0tahqO9Kyw.text: BOMB. I was in Phoenix for a dentist app and I'm from California so we have soul food spots everywhere! The reviews don't lie! Stop in before my flight at the food is amazing! I had the 8p shrimp combo with okra! The staff is great and the food is made fresh to order so you may have to wait a bit! But other then that I would def recommend this place! I will be back next dentist trip!!!!

gB0FnFMvYjqlROxoaV3RPQ.text: OMG, this place is a "Hole in the wall"but the food is BOMB and prices are reasonable.  The catfish was very good seasoned well and peach cobbler(great)collard greens,mac n cheese,fried okra was great and the older gentlemen was very nice.  I order more food weekly...GREAT JOB PJ fish n que.

-ABmmnLms3jFJXCfMTUb7Q.text: MY TIP: "We ordered the spicy catfish and the regular whiting...OMG the whiting!!!"  Found this place on Yelp, surprised we hadn't seen it earlier, and wanted something different. We felt like having seafood but really don't like the overpriced chain seafood restaurants (Red Lobster, Pappadeaux's) that are never as good as they show or charge.   Anyway, found this place and it had great reviews - must be good. And yeah, not disappointed. We usually order directly from Yelp photos, so we really already knew what we wanted but were surprised at how much was on the menu.   One Catfish combo  (Joe recommend spicy) and a Whiting combo (regular batter). We got various sides to share and try. I would have to say, I wasn't impressed by the sides, but they were good. Just your good ol' average comfort-food sides, but the real star was the battered fish. I love catfish - so I always order it, but I wasn't as in love this time. It was good, didn't have as much flavor for me, so maybe I will try the regular batter next time. But the whiting - I would order that again. I don't know if it was the batter or what, tasted almost like lemon pepper, that was delish! Portions were plenty - I was kind of happy my boyfriend couldn't eat all of his and I finished his Whiting (oink oink).   Overall we enjoyed our meal and we will definitely be back. The restaurant was comfortable, overall pretty clean, wasn't too crowded, there was a TV with Family Feud playing so we were all guessing along, and service was decent.   That's what I have to say about it.

1D7ksR3ltgbIkJoVzRXZsA.text: Checked out this place last night. Had the spicy catfish, Mac and cheese, and fries. Catfish was cooked very well. Not that spicy, but they had some franks and that made it great. Mac and cheese was on point. Fries were just average. For the price, this place was great. Highly recommended.

o-lNAVEhsudy1D4UrUp2iw.text: I had the cajun catfish and fried okra.  The food was hot and fresh.  We ate around noon and there was a steady stream of people that came in as we dined...  It took about 15 minutes to get our food, but we weren't in a hurry.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Catfish and Okra

YCuefppFEiCV5iUIp-2a5Q.text: Who would have thought if I wanted a good fish fry I would have to make the trip back to the area I formally lived in? Now let's get down to what I ordered I got the 3 piece catfish with 4 shrimp and greens as my side on top of that I ordered a hot link sandwich because my cholesterol isn't as high as it should be says the doc now the greens this was my first time ever having greens and I have been missing out flavorful and tender I lapped that shit up the shrimp was excellent good sized the catfish is very good good seasoning and it bites back (crunch) if your brave or fat go for the 3 piece meal. Now on to the hot link sammich for once I had a hot link sandwich that has heat to it clearly cooked not reheated. All and all this place is a gem I may have been late coming here but I'm glad I made it.

9BFfLZLMU4V03rGZH_nd_w.text: I was craving soulfood one night and I didn't know where to turn! Lol. I'm originally from California Bay Area to be exact so we're super multicultural and we have so many soulfood and down south comfort food restaurants it's crazy! But since I moved to Arizona 9 months ago I hadn't found one the suited my tastebuds yet! Until last week it was almost 8 o clock I was craving and hungry I was yelping restaurants and PaPas was the only one that was still open. The nice gentleman took my order over the phone I drove about 7 minutes away and picked up my hot link combo with Mac and cheese, potato salad, baked beans, collard greens, and peach cobbler. I was highly satisfied and slept like a baby afterwards. The hot link was good ooh wee was it spicy one of the HOTTEST.... Hot links I have EVER had since Louisiana where my family's from. The Macaroni was A1 I am like guru of Macaroni and cheese so it says a lot, the collard greens were tender and seasoned to perfection, potato salad was good, and I could taste bbq sauce in the baked beans. I'm going back really soon... my new spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot link combo, Mac and cheese, potato salad, collard greens, pinto beans, and peach cobbler!

KA7Z70y0DzMU4Kx0LLBCXw.text: Our office ordered from here for the first time in 2014, and I have been HOOKED ever since! Their fried catfish nuggets ARE AMAZING as well as their onion rings and fried okra.  If you are in the mood for some GREAT TASTING southern cooking...try them out!  These are the best items I highly recommend   *catfish fillets/nuggets *fried okra *onion rings *ribs *greens

KUq8OQvJQS61TDXPtX90_w.text: Fresh fish and great prices. Had the catfish and onion rings, both amazing.  The service was quick and you can tell it is a family owned restaurant, very polite.

Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A great place to eat

V1HxP_rAGjev8RLLefJqzw.text: Best catfish in Arizona. Big portions and very fresh. I definitely recommend eating here you will keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best fish in arizona. The owner is super nice all our the staff are amazing as well. Definitely will be a loyal customer

jtMoNk48lIiXRlr9o11hZg.text: I was really skeptical of this place because I lived in Phoenix almost 10 years and never been here, passed by bit several times as a matter of fact. But...I went to lunch here with a friend and had the 1piece catfish combo and I was pleasantly surprised! Okay here are the pros and con's: Pros: Taste is on point! Seasoned well but not salty. No weird old fish taste. Food was piping hot. Also, they were relatively quick with putting out our order. They were very polite and the cost was VERY inexpensive!  Cons: the smallest combo came with 1piece of fish 2 shrimp, side and drink. While its nice all are included in the city combo the two little shrimp includes were well...funny to me.  That's it, I will definitely go back when I am back in Phoenix!

XWvZv8GyOUiAaGVrgpqcJQ.text: So after trying probably the worst "so-called soul food" restaurant, we didn't want to waste anymore of our time. We've been in Phoenix for a year & a half. Nothing. That changed when we went to Papa Joes. Our friends suggested that we go & we trust their judgment. So here we go.   We went in & ordered our food, sat down & waited for our number "72" to be called. Food took a little longer than anticipated but we waited. Then I heard 74, 75, 76, 77. At this point we're like wait, what's going on? The owner looked over at us and asked us what number we were & we told him. He asked the cook & apparently he forgot. Of course that was very upsetting. My husband now wanted to leave. But nonetheless,  the owner was concerned & apologized. They got our food together and it came right up.   He ordered the wing dinner with Mac & cheese & peach cobbler with Pink lemonade.  I had the half & half spicy & mild catfish nuggets & a sweet potato pie & grape Kool aid.  Our meals, delicious. My catfish nuggets, more than amazing. Oh & the price for it all, no more than $25. We had just spent $55 for a little less food at Off Da Hook Soul Food & had the worst service & food. I didn't expect the catfish nuggets to be so big and it was a 12 piece.     We want to go back today. Definitely getting the same thing. This time I'm going with greens. The mac was good but wasn't our favorite. So the wait was definitely worth it and the food, amazingly good. Best catfish we've ever had, hands down. 5 stars is a must.

em3UUZ6fOmlJIClaC_kMWw.text: Wow, I totally would not have come here if it weren't for Yelp. My dentist is right across the street and my appt. ended right around dinner time so we decided to come here.   My fiance got the wings and onion rings, I got the catfish with shrimp and fried okra, and we got a peach cobbler and sweet potato pie to go. Everything was good, and not too heavy or greasy. I wasn't a fan of the peach cobbler, I wonder if they used canned peaches bc something didn't taste right, can't pin point what. Sweet potato pie was good though!   Owner is friendly, lot of locals seem to frequent this place and it looks like he is on a first name basis with them; always a good sign.  Can't wait to return and try more items off their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TzSN2P-vWDGrRRtEqbCsLA.text: I was killing time in the neighborhood waiting to shop with a friend and saw the great reviews on Yelp. I won't lie, being a Soul Food spot, I wanted to see if there were any reviews from Black people who said it was good...a legitimate metric! The reviews did not lie.   Customer service was great. The owner came from behind the counter to explain the menu on the wall to  newbies who lingered. Your food is cooked fresh, so expect to wait 15 minutes or so for your order. The restaurant has seating for about 20 customers, and a couple of tables on a small patio. Very unpretentious, but clean. It's all about the food.   I ordered the one piece spicy catfish combo, which came with two pieces of shrimp,two sides and a drink for six bucks. Really??? And it was plenty.   The fish was well-seasoned, piping hot and not greasy. The collard greens were good. Not bland, but not as flavorful as my taste buds prefer. Nothing a packet of hot sauce can't solve. But they won at having a smoky flavor without being greasy. The jalapeno hush puppies? Pure perfection! I added the peach cobbler, which was wonderful. I like lots of crust, and it delivered.   In a nutshell, I will drive out of my way to come back. It's worth the drive.

y6yWhbUCYFSCIZoFmTwaCg.text: Some of the Best tasting Catfish that I've eaten out here in PHX. Reminds of what I used to get back home in East Texas. Turns out that most of Papa Joe's family are from Texas and they brought back those great tasting flavors to AZ. Nice!  Love their simple menu of tasty treats. Catfish, Cod, and Whiting are all available in both regular or spicy. They have Shrimp, Hot Wings, Chicken Strips, BBQ Brisket, BBQ Pork, Ribs, Hot Links as well as Burgers and then some. The choices of sides are also a bonus and include items like Collard Greens, fried Okra, Potato Salad, Cole Slaw, Jalapeno Hush Puppies, Mac & Cheese, Onion Rings, Sweet Potato Tater Tots, Beans ... too many to list them all.  Normally get the 3 pc Spicy Catfish with 4 Shrimp and a side of whatever with a giant Grape Drink. Boy that brings back the memories. My wife usually gets the Cod and Shrimp Basket with a side. I have not tried the BBQ yet but definitely have it on my radar for next time.  Papa Joe and his crew are extremely friendly and most helpful. Everything is very good and you can tell they put a lot of Love and Soul into their food. Don't forget a little Granny Ann's Sweet Potato Pie, Peach Cobbler, Cheese Cake, or Pecan Pie to finish off your meal.  Give Papa Joe a shout out and you will be pleased. Located in a small strip shop on the south side of Bethany and not in the hospital across street like the Yelp map suggest. TOUCHDOWN!  5 STARS

Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2 piece Cod and Shrimp with Potato Salad.
Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3pc Spicy Catfish and Shrimp Basket.

QXWTOeOs1ZmaPzN00b_lvQ.text: The catfish was delicious. Perfectly seasoned, crispy and a very thin batter. If your going to eat fried food (and you normally don't) this is the place to have it. Pulled pork, jalapeno hushpuppies, baked beans, fried shrimp and cornbread was all devoured by my family. However, don't be in a rush. It took an hour to get our food. Very busy place.

MKPLm8iJYglmOdk64o23fA.text: Talk about a hole in the wall. Great fried catfish! The mac and cheese was a little light on the flavor side and the sweet potato tots were pretty good. Booths are super uncomfortable to sit in so make sure you grab a regular table.

dWS6iXQErUzqsRggQpX7vA.text: Everything on the menu is amazing. You can call in your order ahead of time and pick it up with no wait. Prices are amazing and the peach cobbler is so good! You want southern food? come here.

2GnLVFZlktVmX3bhvY_USQ.text: Excellent! Support family owned small business. The Catfish is amazing perfectly seasoned and breaded to fry to perfection. Not oily at all. Orders take some time to be ready but  everything is made fresh. Parking can be difficult due to sharing with other small businesses. But overall great!!! I am happy I found this great Fried Fish little joint.

tqCHLM3GYzy5rgqbVw_73g.text: My first time here... looks like a real "dive" Smells of fried fish! Packed for lunch with locals. Ordered pulled Pork Sandwich with 2 sides (Fried Okra & Jalapeno Hushpuppies) & drink of your choice... Total $6.97! 45pC1Tv7FyI0GraMOJa7GA.text: This is my 3rd time eating. Here and the food is always fresh and tasteful great job keep up the good work. Papa joe if you like southern this place is it.

pFcIqyRxRHViy53OFFf_ug.text: Love the food here it's always good and the service is good as well. Only sad part is that this is far from my home.

hx1G1lB0CfqDAL5XdnvZ_Q.text: Not a bad place for some fish when you need a fix. For those that complain about the decor, this is a fish shack, if you want to pay double to eat in a better decorated and more modern establishment then by all mean venture onto Centeral. If you want good fish at a good price then this is your place.  I had the 1pc Cod (Spicy)/2Shrimp w/ Mac & Cheese Im not sure if the batter was the spicy part of the sauce, but the batter was not spicy to me. However, all the fish was battered nicely (not full of grease) and the tarter and cocktail sauce was very good and had a bit of a kick. To cure my spice crave I got some hot sauce by the pop machine and that did the trick. The Mac & Cheese was a bit bland, but everything was piping hot!  All the staff was fantastically friendly and very helpful.  Its not a bad place if you need a F&C fix.

s2RteAEt3lo1JWCsDFrkfQ.text: A few people had been telling me about this place for a while and had been wanting to try it. Happened to be in the area with my family and had to see what it do.   Ordered the 2 piece catfish with shrimp for my wife, 3 piece ribs for myself and a 2 piece ribs for my kids. The catfish was perfectly seasoned. I'm normally skeptical about ordering ribs anywhere I go due to the lack of meat on the bones. Wasn't disappointed there. And they were cooked to perfection. Very juicy and the meat came off the bone with ease. Portions weren't bad as well. I could've eaten more but I'm a big dude at 6'9".   The sides we chose were cornbread, greens, potato salad and Mac n cheese. I went on a limb and tried the greens n Mac n cheese because I heard they were good but...I like mine better lol.   Definitely a place I'll revisit again but for different sides.  Enjoy!!

Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2 piece catfish and potato salad
Photo of Papa Joe's Fish-N-Que - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 piece ribs

rfK5S_aWNRSKyOt6v6ZXrg.text: It was good. I like the wings and mac and cheese. Will be back. Make sure to get spicy if you like flavor!!

OfrmU4z07V2eYZYnGonL5w.text: I had a hankering for some fried and thought I'd give this place a try based on many of the positive reviews from my fellow Yelp community.   After trying it, I have to say there isn't one ounce of regret in doing so....read on.  Location & Aesthetics - Located in in Phoenix on Bethany Road opposite the Phoenix Baptist Hospital. The restaurant isn't difficult to miss with their large sign but the street can be busy with traffic behind you so it's not easy to slow down and you can miss it if you don't know where it is.  Thankfully my trusty phone GPS pinpointed the exact spot. Parking can be somewhat difficult as the parking spots are limited and whatever are available are shared with other businesses.   There is a small street parallel to Bethany Road that must be used to access the restaurant and some of the other businesses and I believe one can park there as I saw a customer parking there but don't quote me on this.   The restaurant itself is a bit dimly lit but there are large windows in front that provide light.  The restaurant is a bit old too and could probably use a sprucing up in redecoration as some of the ceiling tiles had prior leak spots/stains.  The restaurant itself, most importantly, was very clean.    Menu - Clearly visible but not above or behind the cashier/order/checkout area but rather to the left on the wall.  Clear and concise.     Service - The staff was spectacularly nice, friendly, warm and welcoming.  Any questions were answered promptly.      Food - I had the whiting and my wife had the catfish.  Mind you, I have never had or tasted these two particular types of fish.  The side I had with mine was the fried okra (yet another item I've never had) and my wife had the coleslaw. The fish was well fried with not too much batter and very well seasoned.  It was soft and tender and didn't have any briny taste to it.  This opinion applied to both the whiting and the catfish. The fried okra was the perfect combination of batter and okra.  I was able to easily break it apart and see the okra which was well cooked and none of the slimy was evident from the okra itself. Another thing to note is the 2-piece plate does come with 3 pieces of shrimp (fried) which was very tasty and delicious, and a drink.    Despite never had whiting and catfish in my life, I have to say that I'm now hooked on it and since I left, I've been craving on returning to this restaurant to have more!

1ttVM76hm8pNjRDK0uosMA.text: The food is great!  Catfish is huge. Collard greens were excellent. People were very helpful and friendly

i7ZveNsaTCsyHV--epseKg.text: Consistently delicious, no matter what you order. Very friendly and laid back atmosphere. Orders take a bit, but everything is cooked and fried to perfection. Come at least once a week. Never disappointed
